locutie.beschrijving: A historical and theological exposition of Daniel 5, contextualized within the Maccabean revolt and the 1980s political climate. It defines 'apocalyptic' as God's invasion of history.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher provides significant historical-critical background (Antiochus Epiphanes, Hellenism) to ground the narrative.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is asserting the reality of God's sovereignty over empires, transitioning into an encouragement (commissive) for the Catholic Worker community.
voorbeelden: God has numbered the days of your kingdom.
The Most High rules the kingdom of men.
May we bear our witness to the Son of Man.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To empower the marginalized listeners to endure political pressure and see their small acts of service as part of God's eternal kingdom.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned as the source of Daniel's wisdom, but not explicitly invoked as the agent of the sermon's current effect.

voorbeelden: The world of that time was like our own.
Apocalyptic theology has to do with God.
Belshazzar clearly believes the God of the Jews is impotent.
Take no part in the unfruitful works of darkness.
I certainly never saw it until I was trained.
God would vindicate the loyalty of his servants.
His kingdom is one that will never be destroyed.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. The promises are often framed as historical certainties or future generalities rather than direct 'I promise you' addresses.

voorbeelden: God has ripped apart the curtain.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with the authority of a teacher/prophetic witness rather than a sacramental priest.

constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced, but remains an observer of a historical drama.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer may feel the weight of the 'call for endurance' without the direct 'event' of being empowered by the word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are mediated through the text of Daniel rather than directly spoken by the preacher to the congregation.
voorbeelden: God would vindicate the loyalty of his servants.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal testimony of the preacher's own learning process.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the Catholic Worker community at the end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to connect the historical Daniel to the current listeners.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about Daniel, Belshazzar, and 'the people of God'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel for the first 60% of the text.

actueel_present.gebruik: Application to the 1980 election and the local community.

foutief_patroon.probleem: The sermon avoids legalism; it is more informative than moralistic.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The preacher moves from the Assertive (History of Daniel) to a Declarative/Commissive (God's sovereignty) to a Directive (Endurance).
voorbeelden: God has ripped apart the curtain... therefore... bear our witness.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late; the 'event' only occurs in the final paragraphs.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because God's dominion is everlasting, we can act in the dark.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a 're-education' of the hearer's worldview, correcting a lack of apocalyptic understanding.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The detailed description of Antiochus Epiphanes.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid foundation for the 'why' of the text.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on Hellenistic culture.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the encounter with the living Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event at the very end when the preacher addresses the 'Catholic Worker' directly, but much of the text is 'talking about'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon is more of an 'unveiling' (revelation) than a 'doing' (sacrament).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the verbs, but rarely the direct speaker in the sermon's present tense.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a 'discerner' and 'teacher' rather than a 'herald' of a present decree.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher trusts the 'apocalyptic vision' to change the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: The spirit of the holy gods...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is viewed as a means of 'opening eyes'.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has ripped apart the curtain.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God would vindicate the loyalty of his servants.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a historical possibility to a present reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are buried in historical narrative.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'Toezegging' (Promise) as the bridge between the story of Daniel and the life of the Catholic Worker.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you, who serve the lowly, God promises: your work is not in vain.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'You' only appears at the end.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'You' throughout the historical narrative.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like the Jews under Antiochus, you too face the pressure to assimilate.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good, though the indicative is very long.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Shorten the historical indicative to allow more room for the performative indicative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant intellectual and prophetic piece that could be transformed into a powerful sacramental event by shifting from 'talking about' Daniel to 'proclaiming to' the workers.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about not seeing the thread; SAT focuses on the 'unveiling' as a divine act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'tapestry' metaphor; SAT asks if the metaphor actually *does* something to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is delayed by its 'constative surplus' in the historical section.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has ripped apart the curtain.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the turning point where the sermon becomes an event.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Lecture' that finds its 'Homiletical Heart' only in the final third.
